selected_quotes: France's Emmanuel Macron is exploiting public fear to hand the state greater powers
My latest article on Macron's planned counterterrorism law
France plans to make most of its 'state of emergency' laws permanent
Are you a @StirUni @StirlingGradSch PhD? Read @FraserJMcQueen blog on writing for @ConversationUK
France has been under a state of emergency for 2 years. But Macron's plan to end could be worse for civil liberties

citation.abstract: France has been living under a a state of emergency for nearly two years. The president now wants to make some of its most controversial elements permanent law.
citation.title: Inside Emmanuel Macron's draconian anti-terrorism law
